techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: 'Where tillage begins, other arts follow. The farmers therefore are the founders of human civilization.' - Daniel Webster

techs.name: Basic Tools
techs.quote: 'The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.' - J. Paul Getty

techs.name: Archery
techs.quote: 'The haft of the arrow has been feathered with one of the eagle's own plumes, we often give our enemies the means of our own destruction' - Aesop

techs.name: Sailing
techs.quote: 'He who commands the sea has command of everything.' - Themistocles

techs.name: Bronze Working
techs.quote: 'Here Hector entered, with a spear eleven cubits long in his hand; the bronze point gleamed in front of him, and was fastened to the shaft of the spear by a ring of gold.' - Homer

techs.name: The Wheel
techs.quote: 'Wisdom and virtue are like the two wheels of a cart.' - Japanese proverb

techs.name: Writing
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Culture]
techs.quote: 'He who destroys a good book kills reason itself.' - John Milton

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: 'How happy are those whose walls already rise!' - Virgil

techs.name: Religion
techs.quote: 'There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.' - Socrates

techs.name: Mathematics
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Gold]
techs.quote: 'Mathematics is the gate and key to the sciences.' - Roger Bacon

techs.name: Iron Working
techs.quote: 'Do not wait to strike til the iron is hot, but make it hot by striking.' - William Butler Yeats

techs.name: Horseback Riding
techs.quote: 'A Horse! A Horse! My kingdom for a horse!' - Shakespeare (Richard III)

techs.name: Education
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Science]
techs.quote: 'Education is the best provision for old age.' - Aristotle

techs.name: Construction
techs.quote: 'Three things are to be looked to in a building: that it stands on the right spot; that it be securely founded; that it be successfully executed.' - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

techs.name: Warrior Code
techs.quote: 'Whoso pulleth out this sword of this stone and anvil, is rightwise king born of all England.' - Malory

techs.name: Physics
techs.quote: 'Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.' - Galileo Galilei

techs.name: Gunpowder
techs.quote: 'The day when two army corps can annihilate each other in one second, all civilized nations, it is to be hoped, will recoil from war and discharge their troops.' - Alfred Nobel

techs.name: Military Science
techs.quote: 'Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.' - George S. Patton

techs.name: Economics
techs.quote: 'Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Chemistry
uniques: Enables [Embarked] units to enter ocean tiles
techs.quote: 'Wherever we look, the work of the chemist has raised the level of our civilization and has increased the productive capacity of the nation.' - Calvin Coolidge

techs.name: Dynamite
techs.quote: 'As soon as men decide that all means are permitted to fight an evil, then their good becomes indistinguishable from the evil that they set out to destroy.' - Christopher Dawson

techs.name: Liberalism
techs.quote: 'Men, like bullets, go farthest when they are smoothest.' - Jean Paul

techs.name: Industrialization
techs.quote: 'Industrialization based on machinery, already referred to as a characteristic of our age, is but one aspect of the revolution that is being wrought by technology.' - Emily Greene Balch

techs.name: Medicine
techs.quote: 'And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, and near a thousand tables pined and wanted food.' - William Wordsworth

techs.name: Electricity
techs.quote: 'Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.' - Henry Ford

techs.name: Plastics
techs.quote: 'Ben, I want to say one word to you, just one word: plastics.' - Buck Henry and Calder Willingham, The Graduate

techs.name: Radio
techs.quote: 'The whole country was tied together by radio. We all experienced the same heroes and comedians and singers. They were giants.' - Woody Allen

techs.name: Combustion
techs.quote: 'The introduction of so powerful an agent as steam to a carriage on wheels will make a great change in the situation of man.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: 'Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.' - Igor Sikorsky

techs.name: Electronics
techs.quote: 'There's a basic principle about consumer electronics: it gets more powerful all the time and it gets cheaper all the time.' - Trip Hawkins

techs.name: Automobile
techs.quote: 'Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Nuclear Fission
techs.quote: 'I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.' - J. Robert Oppenheimer

techs.name: Internet
techs.quote: 'The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.' - J.B. Priestly

techs.name: Combined Arms
techs.quote: 'All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Rocketry
techs.quote: 'A good rule for rocket experimenters to follow is this: always assume that it will explode.' - Astronautics Magazine, 1937

techs.name: Artificial Intelligence
uniques: Who knows what the future holds?
techs.quote: 'I think we agree, the past is over.' - George W. Bush

techs.name: Nuclear Fusion
uniques: Who knows what the future holds?
techs.quote: 'The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has readily made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Space Flight
uniques: Who knows what the future holds?
techs.quote: 'Now, somehow, in some new way, the sky seemed almost alien.' - Lyndon B. Johnson
